RulesName: When a noun occurs twice in the same sentence, the second occurrence becomes a Pronoun
Comment: Clauses 1:68 When John walks, he sings.  The second noun must have a Surface Realization value of Not Applicable because previous rules may have set that noun to Big Pro Plus.  If that noun is Big Pro Plus, don't change it to a regular pronoun.  Also if the second nominal is in a Relativized NP, don't convert it to a pronoun.    The second noun can't be in a Bare Stem PrenominalThing-Thing Relationship.  Avian Influenza 1:1  After Paulus returned to his village, he said to Isak, who was the village chief ...  *there chief  I set the first noun to Third Person so that this rule won't apply in 1 Samuel 28:9 You(Saul) certainly know about the thing that Saul did.  The first noun's Surface Realization can't be PRO as in Gen. 49:9 Who wants to wake up a lion?-*-  Don't convert a noun in a 'named' phrase to a pronoun.  Gen. 27:30 *After Isaac finished blessing Jacob, Jacob left his father named him.-*-  This structure causes a problem in Gen. 24:57 Rebekah's older brother and her mother said, "We will ask Rebekah whether REBEKAH wants to leave or REBEKAH wants to stay."  Luke 7:22  Then Jesus said to John's disciples, "Go to John."  *Then Jesus said to John's disciples, "Go to him."  When a noun occurs in the quotation frame and in the quote, don't allow the one in the quote to be converted to a pronoun by the previous structure.  Luke 2:34 Simeon said to Mary, who was the child's mother, "Some people that live in Israel will hate this child."  *Simeon said to Mary, who was the child's mother, "Some people that live in Israel will hate him." -*-  The first structure in this rule doesn't apply to Equative clauses.  Esther 7:6  The man that hates my people is this wicked man named Haman.  *The man ... is him.  The first structure also doesn't apply to Kinship clauses.  Kande's Story 2:18 You're my baby now.   *You're him now.  I changed the second NP from State to NOT Subject and checked the 'Ignore Phrase Embedding' option for sentences like Exodus 20:5:3 I'm the Lord your God.  I added Social Role for Gen. 24:34 That servant said, "I'm Abraham's servant."-*-  The first structure in this rule doesn't apply to Equative clauses.  Gen. 17:7 I will be your God and your descendants' God forever.  This structure prevents the State NP of the first Equative clause from triggering structure 1 of this rule.-*-  The previous structures of this rule shouldn't apply to nouns in State NPs of Name propositions.   Ex. 6:3   My true name is Yahweh.  It also doesn't apply in Equative propositions. Ex. 7:5 ... they'll know that I'm Yahweh.  I set the Noun's Person to Third because we don't want this structure to apply to First and Second person pronouns.  Gen. 32:27 What is your name?-*-  This rule doesn't apply to 'made of' NPs which are Pre-Nominal Modifiers.   1 Samuel 6:4 five gold tumors and five gold rats.-*-  This rule doesn't apply to nouns in Addressee NPs.   Genesis 22:11  -*-

RulesName: When a noun-noun combination occurs twice in the same sentence, the second occurrence becomes a Pronoun
Comment: Philippians 2:8  Messiah Jesus proved that he was very humble by ...-*-  Luke 7:22  Then Jesus said to John's disciples, "Go to John."  *Then Jesus said to John's disciples, "Go to him."  When a noun occurs in the quotation frame and in the quote, don't allow the one in the quote to be converted to a pronoun by the previous structure.  Luke 2:34 Simeon said to Mary, who was the child's mother, "Some people that live in Israel will hate this child."  *Simeon said to Mary, who was the child's mother, "Some people that live in Israel will hate him." -*-  The first structure in this rule doesn't apply to Equative clauses.  Esther 7:6  The man that hates my people is this wicked man named Haman.  *The man ... is him.-*-

RulesName: When two consecutive sentences have the same subject nominal, use a pronoun if there's no intervening referents of the same gender
Comment: Singular Feminine Subjects: Infected Eye 1:2  One day Melissa was sitting outside her house.  But she was not happy ...  Both props must be Independent because I don't want this rule to fire on subjects of subordinate clauses. Infected Eye 1:14  Then Janet said to Melissa, "You... "  *So she looked at ...-*-  Singular Feminine Subjects: This structure bleeds from the previous structure.  -*-  Singular Feminine Subjects: This structure bleeds from the previous structure.  Kande's Story 4:9  A woman who attended the church invited the children to live at her house. When Kande's mother was sick, *she had ...-*-  Singular Feminine Subjects: This structure bleeds from the previous structure.  -*-  Singular Feminine Subjects: This structure bleeds from the previous structure.  There's a bug in the software so I can't set the second NP with a feminine referent to Not Present.-*-  Singular Masculine Subjects:  Infected Eye 1:7  Alex knew that Melissa's eyes were very sore.  He said to Melissa, ...  Avian Influenza 3:11 is a good illustration of this rule.  The Surface Realization of the Subject Noun in the second sentence must be Noun, not Big PRO as in Bible Stories 44:2.  Let's leave these people.  And let's go ...-*-  Singular Masculine Subjects: This structure bleeds from the previous structure. -*-  Singular Masculine Subjects: This structure bleeds from the previous structure.  -*-  Singular Masculine Subjects: This structure bleeds from the previous structure.   The extra embedded clause is for Luke 6:22. ... God will bless you. If people say bad things to you [ because you follow the Son of Man (masculine) ], God (masculine) will bless you.  We want the the second occurrence of God to be God rather than he.-*-  Singular Masculine Subjects: This structure bleeds from the previous structure. -*-  Singular Masculine Subjects: This structure bleeds from the previous structure.  Kande's Story 4:3 Sometimes Ajani visited Kande and brought his younger brother.  Example with object complement: Gen. 29:23  Jacob thought that Laban brought Rachel to him.  *So he slept with Leah that night.-*-  Plural Masculine Subjects:  Daniel 6:4 Then the other officials started watching Daniel.  They were jealous of Daniel.  This rule doesn't apply if the noun is initially Big Pro Plus.  Jonah 1:7  The men said ... Let's use lots ...-*-  Singular Neuter Subjects:  Daniel 8:6 The goat was very angry.  So the goat attached the ram.  Don't set the noun to a pronoun if there's a preposed adverbial clause in the second sentence.  Exodus 12:6 Each family ... While the sun is setting, each family ...-*-  Two Subjects: Daniel 1:1  Nebuchadnezzar and his army went to Jerusalem.  Then they attacked Jerusalem.  -*-  Three Subjects: Daniel 3:23  So Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego fell into the extremely hot fire.  They had been tied with ropes.  Philemon 1:24 Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke serve God with me.  They also greet you.-*-  Four Subjects:  Philemon 1:24 Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke serve God with me.  They also greet you.-*-  Don't include titles in this pronoun rule.  Gen. 1:1  Title: God creates the heavens and the earth.  *He existed before all things.-*-  Don't include sentences that are the end of a quotation in this pronoun rule.  Gen. 16:8  Where are you going?  *She answered, ...-*-  This structure is unnecessary because TBTA doesn't search past quotation marks when executing the pronoun identification rules, so I turned this structure off.  Don't include sentences that are the end of a quotation in this pronoun rule.  Bible Stories 66:9 Judas said, "Teacher." And then Judas kissed Jesus.-*-  This rule doesn't apply to a noun with Negative Polarity as in Luke 8:16  No person puts a lamp in a jar.  And no person puts a lamp under a bed.-*-  Don't let first and second person pronouns participate in this rule.  Gen. 17:10  You and your descendants have to obey this law.  *You (and your descendants) will be circumcised.-*-  Don't let alternative analyses participate in this rule.  Philippians 4:5 The Lord will return to the earth soon.  *He is close to you.-*-  Don't let footnotes participate in this rule.  Ruth 4:12 Tamar birthed Perez for Judah.  Footnote: Tamar was from ...  Matthew 2:15  -*-  Sometimes titles occur in the middle of a verse, and those sentences shouldn't look to the previous sentence for pronouns.   Mark 6:6  -*-

RulesName: Combine conjoined pronouns
Comment: Conjoined Subject Third Person Pronouns: Discourse 1:3  When Saul and his soldiers heard Goliath's words, THEY were very afraid.  Delete the comma in the first NP.  Daniel 3:21  When the strong soldiers tied Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, they were wearing coats.  Don't combine pronouns that have different Person values.  Kande's Story 5:9 she and I ...-*-  Conjoined Object Pronouns: Daniel 4:7  When the magicians, enchanters, astrologers and diviners came to the palace, I told them ...  I made this apply only to Third Person Pronouns so that it won't join "you and me" as in Philippians 1:7 God treats all of you and me kindly always.   I added or for 2 Samuel 19:6 You don't care about them or them.-*-  Conjoined Indirect Object Pronouns:   Exodus 6:8  I promised Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob that I would give the land to THEM.-*-  Conjoined Oblique Pronouns: Luke 20:19 The people who knew the law well and the priests understood that Jesus' story was about them.  I set the indices so that this rule won't apply in 2 Samuel 10:9 Joab saw that the enemies' soldiers were in front of him and behind him.-*-  Conjoined Possessor Pronouns with Saxon Genitive: Kande's Story 1:4  Kande and Teshi ran to THEIR house quickly.  Delete all the NPs except the last one because it has the Saxon Genitive clitic which is necessary to generate the possessive pronoun.  I changed an earlier rule so that if there are multiple possessors, we always use Norman genitives, so I had to modify this rule also to include Norman genitives.  And now this rule also has to delete the Article that is associated with Norman genitives.-*-  Mark 10:41  ... the disciples became angry with them.  Note: use the first phrase because there might be a preposition in it.-*-

RulesName: Subjects of Imperatives surface as Big Pro Plus
Comment: Clauses 1:90 Read a book.-*-

RulesName: Delete Optional Agents of Passives
Comment: Genesis 17:10  You and your descendants must be circumcised.-*-

RulesName: When there's an intervening noun of the same gender between a noun and a coreferential pronoun, set the pronoun back to a noun
Comment: Locations: Ruth 1:2  *This family moved from Bethlehem to Moab because there was a famine there.  Set the second occurrence of Bethlehem back to a noun.  Note: Occassionally a person is referred to in the Second Person (e.g., Matt. 2:6 But you, Bethlehem, you are very important ...").  So I tagged these nouns as Third Person.-*-  Masculine third person singular pronouns: Luke 10:31  *But when the priest saw the man, he walked on the other side of the road past him.  Change second occurrence of man back to a noun.  Luke 10:33 *But when that man came to the man, he saw him.  Luke 2:28  When Simeon saw Jesus, he held Jesus.  Luke 5:12  *When the man saw Jesus, he bowed to him.  This rule doesn't apply if the intervening nominal is Big Pro Plus. Discourse 1:7 Then David went to Saul and PRO said to him, ...  If the first nominal is the Subject, let the second nominal remain a pronoun.  Luke 4:32  When Jesus taught the people about God, he spoke with authority.  The intervening noun must be third person; if it's first or second person, then allow the third noun to remain a pronoun.  Philippians 2:25   You sent Epaphroditus to me so that HE could bring a message to me.  Paul and Epaphroditus are the same gender, but the intervening me shouldn't block he. -*-  Feminine third singular pronouns: Infected Eye 1:10  After Netty looked at Melissa's eyes, she said to Netty, ...  Kande's Story 3:15  After Kande and Teshi left the clinic, she asked Kande, ...-*-  Coordinate Subject nominals have coreferential pronouns converted back to nouns: Esther 5:6  While the king and Haman were drinking wine, the king said ...  Kande's Story 3:15 After Kande and Teshi left the clinic, Teshi asked Kande, ...-*-  When subject of subordinate clause is different from subject of main clause, change subject of main clause from pronoun to noun.  Esther 5:9 When Haman walked near Mordecai, Mordecai did not bow to Haman.-*-  If the first subject nominal occurs again in another subject nominal of the same clause, let it remain a pronoun.  Kande's Story 4:7  So Kande and her family worked very hard.  This structure prevents one of the previous structures from converting the second nominal back to a noun.  Luke 9:32  Peter and the two men that were with him ...-*-

RulesName: Reflexive Pronouns
Comment: Pronouns 1:21 I saw myself.-*-  If the Beneficiary NP is coreferential with the Subject NP, then the beneficiary must be a reflexive pronoun.  Luke 12:21  The man stored many things for himself.-*-  Genesis 45:5  Don't be angry with yourselves.-*-

RulesName: Reciprocal Pronoun
Comment: Ephesians 4:32 Be kind to each other.-*-  Pronouns 1:34 We saw each other.-*-

RulesName: Locative Pronouns
Comment: For all other prepostions that aren't listed in structure 2, we'll keep them, so this structure doesn't delete them.  But a preposition must be present in order to mark the noun as a locative pronoun.  Gen. 11:9 The people called that place 'Babel' ...-*-  Pronouns 1:40 My house is there.  I had this rule applying to all adpositions, but I changed it so it only applies to 'at' because of constructions like in Gen. 1:7 Some water was above that place.  And other water was below that place.-*-  This structure is turned off. I'm trying to put all the prepositions into the first structure Ruth 4:1 Come here.-*-  Luke 4:9  Jump down from here.  We need the from so this structure prevents the preceding structure from deleting it.-*-  Luke 16:28 warn my brothers about this place.  When the adposition is about, don't convert this place to a locative pronoun.-*-  Gen. 19:20  That town is close to here.  We need the to so this structure prevents the first structure from deleting it.-*-

RulesName: Possessive Pronouns
Comment: When there are a series of possessors, only the last NP has the Saxon Genitive clitic.  This structure deals with the NPs that don't have the clitic.  Gen. 28:7 Jacob obeyed HIS father and his mother.-*-  Pronouns 1:40 My house is there.-*-

RulesName: Delete all constituents that modify any type of Pronoun
Comment: Don't delete Descriptive relative claues that modify a pronoun.  Philippians 3:15  You, who are perfect, should think about these things like I think about them.  We need to delete two relative clauses in 1 Thess. 4:1 Paul reminds all the people who believe in Jesus and live in Thessalonica that they ...  I deleted the two Relative Clauses at the end of the NP because of Judges 5:10. You who are on horses ...-*-  Delete all Restrictive Relative Clauses that modify Third Person Pronouns.  Esther 9:19 They (who lived in Susa) celebrated with a feast ... But we want to keep the Relative Clauses that modify First and Second Person Pronouns. Judges 5:10. You who are on horses ...-*-  Certain Identity adjectives should be deleted. 'other' is an Identity adjective, so the next structure won't delete it.  But we need it deleted, so this structure applies specifically to other.    Genesis 49:3  And Reuben will be more powerful than them.  Daniel 6:4.  'right' in Ex. 15:6  'chief' in Dan. 1:7 'Roman' in Luke 23:25  Joshua 15:6:2  the northern border-*-  Delete all Adjective Phrases that don't contain Quantity adjectives or Cardinal Numbers and modify any type of Pronoun.  We need to keep Exclusivity adjectives such as only you and Identity adjectives such as each of you.-*-  When there's a Quantity Adjective or Cardinal Number modifying any type of pronoun other than a Personal Pronoun, delete the Adjective.  Don't delete the cardinal number if it's a subgroup indicator.  Luke 11:1  After Jesus finished praying, one of his disciples said, ...-*-  If there's 'each' without a Subgroup indicator, delete it.  Eph. 5:28 Each husband should love his wife.  He should love ...-*-  When there's a Cardinal Number modifying a Personal Pronoun, and there isn't the Subgroup marker of, delete the entire phrase including the of.  Gen. 19:5  Bring them to us.  If there is a Subgroup marker in the AdjP, don't delete the phrase.  Daniel 7:24  That king will be different from the other kings and will defeat three of them.   -*-  When there's a Quantity adjective with Degree 'too' modifying a Personal Pronoun, then insert of.  Gen. 13:6 But the animals were not able to find enough food there because Abram and Lot had too many of them.-*-  Delete AdjPs from Relativized NPs.  Luke 2:34  Certain people who live in Israel will hate this child.   -*-  This structure is turned off.  Generally we don't delete adpositions before pronouns, but for locative pronouns, we need to delete the prepositions.  Nouns other than 'place' that are locations will be realized with there, and we need to delete the adpositions.  Luke 2:38 ... Anna was there.  *... Anna was at there.-*-  Philippians 3:19  Those people boast about things that they should be ashamed of.  Genesis 6:4:4  The sons of God slept with people's daughters who were living on the earth.-*-  Genesis 3:8  The man and his wife heard the LORD God walking in the garden.  For 'God Named YAHWEH', I have a rule that switches 'Yahweh' to the first NP and 'God' to the embedded NP.  But that switch is done after the Subject NP of the Object Complement clause is marked as Big PRO Plus.  So 'God' gets marked as Big Pro Plus, but 'Yahweh' doesn't.-*-

RulesName: When a Saxon Possessor is modified by another NP which is not a Possessor, convert the Saxon Genitive to a Norman Genitive
Comment: Luke 8:3 Joanna was the wife of a man named Chuza.  *Joanna was a man named Chuza's wife.  Convert the Saxon to a Norman only if the innermost NP is not a possessive NP.  Luke 2:49  I must be in my father's house.  *I must be in the house of my father.  Insert the article the because most of these NPs are Definite rather than Indefinite.-*-  This structure is the same as the previous, except that it deals with proper nouns, so we don't want the article the inserted.  Gen. 32:9  God of my ancestor named Abraham and of my father named Isaac, ...-*-  This structure is the same as the previous, except that it deals solely with 'God' because we want the article the inserted.  Gen. 26:24  the God of your father named Abraham  This rule doesn't apply if the NP is an Addressee as in Gen. 32:9 Jacob prayed, "God of my ancestor named Abraham, ...-*-

RulesName: For certain verbs that include an Adposition, move the adpositions into the Object NP if the NP contains a Pronoun
Comment: For pick up, we usually want the up to remain in the VP, but if the Object NP contains a pronoun, then up must move to the NP.  Ruth 2:16 ... so that Ruth could pick them up.  Instead of moving up, I had to delete it because the NP PSR positions 'Adposition in VP' before the nouns.-*-

RulesName: Delete thing after do and know and say
Comment: Philippians 2:7  He did this by becoming a servant.  Don't delete thing if it's modified by an adjective.  Gen. 19:7 Don't do this evil thing.-*-  Genesis 44:17  I certainly won't do that!-*-  Philippians 1:13 All of the palace guards know this.-*-  Mark 11:14 When Jesus said that thing, ...-*-  Mark 15:2  It was you who said this.-*-  Philippians 1:25 I certainly know that this is true.-*-

RulesName: When the Noun in a Norman Genitive becomes a Pronoun, change the Pronoun to a Possessive Pronoun
Comment: Judges 8:34  the LORD, their God-*-

RulesName: Subjects of certain Adverbial Clauses surface as Big Pro Plus
Comment: Clauses 1:79 Mary read this book in order to help John read that book.  For 'in order to' clauses, sometimes the agent is coreferential with the matrix agent, but sometimes it's coreferential with the matrix patient.  Luke 4:18  God chose me in order to bring good news to poor people.  Whether the agent of the 'in order to' clause is coreferential with the agent or patient of the matrix clause, it gets deleted in the adverbial clause.-*-  Passive 'by' clause  Mark 9:42  ... by being thrown into the sea.-*-

RulesName: Change I and John to John and I
Comment: Philippians 1:1  Timothy and I are ...  If there are three subject NPs, we need to move the comma, as in 1 Thess. 1:1 I, Silas, and Timothy -> Timothy, Silas, and I ...-*-

RulesName: Change 'king there' to 'its king'
Comment: Joshua 10:1  Change Joshua did to Ai and the king there ... to Joshua did to Ai and its king ...-*-

RulesName: Certain pronouns must be Plural
Comment: Mark 3:21  But sometimes we want the pronoun for 'family' to be it as in Mark 3:25 If a family fights itstelf, it won't be able to continue existing.  Mark 15:8  That crowd asked Pilate to do something for them.-*-
